page.title: 09Farming in the Nibley area
page.content: The farms are mostly about 100 acres. This is a good area for pastoral farming in the shadow of the Cotswolds.The majority of stock are dairy and beef cattle.Dairy cattle can be kept cheaply due to high rainfall but milk production has been cut by the European Economic Community milk quotas.This has affected jobs;the EEC bring in imported milk,and more people have turned to growing crops.Milking has become much more advanced due to computerised machines:this makes milking more efficient.More farmers are making silage,although hay is still being made as it aids digestion. Silage is made in round bales and stored in airtight bags to stop it going mouldy.There are special chemicals which double the amount of lactic acid in the grass,so the silage will keep better.
